increase_decrease_other_assets.head: Increase or Decrease in Other Assets

increase_decrease_sundry_creditors.head: Increase or Decrease in Sundry creditors

increase_decrease_other_liability.head: Increase or Decrease in Other Liability

gross_profit_margin.head: Gross Profit Margin
gross_profit_margin.info: The gross profit margin tells you what your business made after paying for the direct cost of doing business, which can include labour, materials and other direct production costs.

net_profit_margin.head: Net Profit Margin
net_profit_margin.info: The net profit margin tells you what your business made after paying for the direct cost and indirect cost (all the expenses).

return_on_equity.head: Return on Equity
return_on_equity.info:
Return on Equity (ROE) measures the profits generated by a company based on investment contributed by shareholders.
Ex. a company with a RoE of 10% means that they generate a profit of Rs 10 for every Rs 100 of its equity.

cashflow_to_sales_ratio.head: Cashflow to Sales Ratio
cashflow_to_sales_ratio.info:
Free cash flow-to-sales is a measure to assess how much cash a company is generating from its sales.
Ex. a company with a CF to Sales Ratio of 60% means that they generate a Cash of Rs 60 for every Rs 100 of sales

working_capital_current_ratio.head: Working Capital Ratio / Current Ratio
working_capital_current_ratio.info:
The current ratio reflects a company’s capacity to pay off all its short-term obligations.
Ex. a company with a Current Ratio of 1.2x means that they have a capacity to pay 1.2x of their current liabilities

cashflow_to_debt_ratio.head: Cashflow to Debt Ratio
cashflow_to_debt_ratio.info:
This metric determine the length of time required for a company to pay off its debt using its cash flow alone. 
For example, if this ratio is 0.25x, that mean it will take 4 years to repay the debt

inventory_turnover.head: Inventory turnover
inventory_turnover.info: This ratio measures the number of times a company sold its total average inventory during the month/year. Higher Turnover is preferred.

accounts_receivable_turnover.head: Accounts receivable turnover
accounts_receivable_turnover.info: The accounts receivable turnover ratio measures the efficiency at which a company can collect its outstanding receivables from customers.

days_payable_outstanding.head: Days payable outstanding (DPO)
days_payable_outstanding.info:
Days payable outstanding is the average number of days it takes for a company to pay its suppliers. 
High days payable outstanding is advantageous because it means the company is taking more time to pay its suppliers and has more balance in the bank account

debt_to_equity_ratio.head: Debt to equity ratio
debt_to_equity_ratio.info: It’s a simple measure of how much debt company uses to run your business. If your debt-to-equity ratio is too high, it’s a signal that your company may be in financial distress.

monthly_burn_rate.head: Monthly Burn Rate
monthly_burn_rate.info: Burn rate is the amount of money you lose per month. In simple term expenses are greater than revenue earned
monthly_burn_rate.ideal: Around 1/12 of available cash and bank

runway.head: Runway
runway.info: Runway is how many months your startup has before it runs out of cash. The longer your runway, the more time you have to build and grow your startup.
